intro: Calyptranthes oreophila, commonly known as the cloud forest calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
